Top-Level Element¶

MathML specifies a single top-level or root math element, which encapsulates each instance of MathML markup within a document. All other MathML content must be contained in a math element; in other words, every valid MathML expression is wrapped in outer <math> tags. The math element must always be the outermost element in a MathML expression; it is an error for one math element to contain another.

Attributes¶

In addition to the attributes listed previously, the math element accepts the following attributes and for a full list look at [1].

display¶

Specifies whether the enclosed MathML expression should be rendered as a separate vertical block (in display style) or inline, aligned with adjacent text.

The possibles values are block and inline (default).

a + b 2 
<math display='block'>
  <msup>
    <mfenced> <mbox> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>b</mi> </mbox> </mfenced> <mn>2</mn>
  </msup>
</math>
a + b 2 
<math display='inline'>
  <msup>
    <mfenced> <mbox> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>b</mi> </mbox> </mfenced> <mn>2</mn>
  </msup>
</math>

maxwidth¶

Specifies the maximum width to be used for linebreaking. The default is the maximum width available in the surrounding environment. If that value cannot be determined, the renderer should assume an infinite rendering width.

overflow¶

Specifies the preferred handing in cases where an expression is too long to fit in the allowed width.

The possibles valueas are linebreak (default), scroll, elide, truncate and scale.

With linebreak, the expression will be broken across several lines.

a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a = 11 a 
<math overflow='linebreak'>
  <mbox>
    <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>=</mo> <mn>11</mn> <mi>a</mi>
  </mbox>
</math>

With scroll, the window provides a viewport into the larger complete display of the mathematical expression. Horizontal or vertical scroll bars are added to the window as necessary to allow the viewport to be moved to a different position.

a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a = 11 a 
<math overflow='scroll'>
  <mbox>
    <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>=</mo> <mn>11</mn> <mi>a</mi>
  </mbox>
</math>

With elide, the display is abbreviated by removing enough of it so that the remainder fits into the window. For example, a large polynomial might have the first and last terms displayed with + ... + between them. Advanced renderers may provide a facility to zoom in on elided areas.

a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a = 11 a 
<math overflow='elide'>
  <mbox>
    <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>=</mo> <mn>11</mn> <mi>a</mi>
  </mbox>
</math>

With truncate, the display is abbreviated by simply truncating it at the right and bottom borders. It is recommended that some indication of truncation is made to the viewer.

a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a = 11 a 
<math overflow='truncate'>
  <mbox>
    <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>=</mo> <mn>11</mn> <mi>a</mi>
  </mbox>
</math>

With scale, the fonts used to display the mathematical expression are chosen so that the full expression fits in the window. Note that this only happens if the expression is too large. In the case of a window larger than necessary, the expression is shown at its normal size within the larger window.

a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a + a = 11 a 
<math overflow='scale'>
  <mbox>
    <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>a</mi>
    <mo>=</mo> <mn>11</mn> <mi>a</mi>
  </mbox>
</math>

altimg¶

Provides a URI referring to an image to display as a fall-back for user agents that do not support embedded MathML.

alttext¶

Provides a textual alternative as a fall-back for user agents that do not support embedded MathML or images.

References

[1]http://www.w3.org/TR/MathML3/chapter2.html
